content.description: Stand start on right hand edge, left hand on the arete. Climb the overhanging face and arete. Top is committing. For full value, starting from a sit on two blocks adds a few fun moves.
content.location: From the base of the approach gulley, take a left past some tall walls and around the corner.

content.description: From a left hand sloper and right hand undercling, pull on and slap up the feature. Either step off the flake or choose your own adventure to finish.Detached blocks are not used.
content.location: The flake directly behind Wisconsin Old Fashioned.

content.description: Stand start with right hand incut jug edge and left hand on a very poor sloper pinch. Climb interesting moves directly up the arete. The upper section is a little tenuous.
content.location: Around the corner of Wisconsin Old Fashion, next to the river.

content.description:
Start on obvious edges (same start as Eddy). Move right through a tough gaston move and up a series of edges. 

 *Only accessible when water is low or frozen*
content.location: On a granite slab situated right on the river. If standing at the base of the approach gulley, follow the cliffline back towards the rapids and traverse out on the granite slab. If water is high, this boulder is inaccessible.

content.description: Stand start left hand on arete, right hand on gaston edge. Tricky and interesting moves lead up the compression feature.
content.location: From the base of the access gulley, take a left past some tall walls and around the corner past Wisconsin Old Fashioned. Continue uphill for another minute or so.

content.description:
Start with obvious edges. A dynamic move left leads to an easing top. A little morpho.

 *Only accessible when water is low or frozen*
content.location: On a granite slab situated right on the river. If standing at the base of the approach gulley, follow the cliffline back towards the rapids and traverse out on the granite slab. If water is high, this boulder is inaccessible.

content.description: Along the North side of the river are numerous granite outcroppings which host a handful of high quality boulder problems. There is potential for more problems here, as well as some routes. Several problems are only accessible when the water level is low.
